articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Message of Sympathy to Russian President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Message of Sympathy to Russian President 
 Pyongyang, June 22 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on Tuesday sent a message of sympathy to Dmitri Medvedev, president of the Russian Federation, as regards the airliner crash in the Republic of Karelia of the Federation that claimed casualties. 
					 Kim in the message expressed deep sympathy and consolation to him and, through him, to the victims and their families.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greetings to Grand Duke of Luxembourg
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greetings to Grand Duke of Luxembourg
 Pyongyang, June 22 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Tuesday sent a message of greeting to Henri, grand duke of the Grand Duchy of Luxembourg, on its national day.
					 Extending congratulations to the grand duke and people of Luxembourg, Kim wished them steady development and prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Election Committees Formed in DPRK
articles.content:
Election Committees Formed in DPRK
 Pyongyang, June 22 (KCNA) -- Preparations for successful elections of deputies to provincial (municipality), city (district) and county people's assemblies are brisk in different parts of the DPRK.
					 Provincial (municipality), city (district) and county election committees for deputies to local people's assembles were formed until  June 21 to begin their work in accordance with the law on elections for deputies to people's assembles at all levels of the DPRK.

articles.title: Pakistani Foreign Ministry Delegation Arrives Here
articles.content:
Pakistani Foreign Ministry Delegation Arrives Here
 Pyongyang, June 22 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Pakistani Foreign Ministry led by its Director General Mohammad Jamshaid Iftikhar Qureshi arrived here today.

articles.title: Director of IIJI Arrives Here
articles.content:
Director of IIJI Arrives Here
 Pyongyang, June 22 (KCNA) -- Takao Kamakura, director of the International Institute of the Juche Idea (IIJI), and his party arrived here today.

articles.title: New Energy-saving Technology Developed
articles.content:
New Energy-saving Technology Developed
 Pyongyang, June 22 (KCNA) -- Scientists of the Heat Engineering Institute of the State Academy of Sciences developed a high temperature air combustion technology.
					 After years of research, they invented high-speed switching device, honeycomb regenerator and other air preheating equipment and devices.
					
					 The energy-saving technology makes it possible to use anthracite, instead of liquid fuel, in industrial furnaces, make full use of heat by raising combustion rate of fuel and reduce consumption of fuel.
					
					 The technology has been applied to some industrial establishments like the Kim Chaek Iron and Steel Complex, Hwanghae Iron and Steel Complex and Hoeryong Earthenware Factory.

articles.title: Taedong River Culture
articles.content:
Taedong River Culture
 Pyongyang, June 22 (KCNA) -- The Taedong River culture is one of the world's five ancient cultures. 
					 Ancient Korea, founded in the early 30th century B.C., created civilization with Pyongyang as the centre.
					
					 Unearthed relics and remains testify to the fact that the Taedong River basin is one of the world's culture cradles, where agriculture, bronze tools, earthenware, astronomy and letters were developed through primitive, ancient and neolithic stages of human evolution.
					
					 In particular, dolmens, stone tombs and ruined communities, castles and houses discovered in the Taedong River basin prove that Pyongyang is a birthplace of ancient civilization. 
					
					 In Juche 87 (1998), the History Society of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, on the basis of many material evidences, decided to name the culture of Tangun Korea developed with Pyongyang as the centre the Taedong River culture, and declared it one of the world's five ancient cultures.

articles.title: New TV Series about Women's Soccer Team
articles.content:
New TV Series about Women's Soccer Team
 Pyongyang, June 22 (KCNA) -- A new TV series "Korean Women's Soccer Team" is now on in the DPRK. 
					 The five-part drama is based on the story about the DPRK women's soccer team, which won the 3rd FIFA U-20 World Championship. 
					
					 The hero of the drama is the team's senior coach, who does his utmost to display the honor of the country all over the world. 
					
					 The drama gives a vivid representation of the girls' high ambition for world cup and their strenuous effort to realize it.
					
					 The cast contains Jon Myong Hui and other celebrated footballers.

articles.title: Premier Soccer League Begins
articles.content:
Premier Soccer League Begins
 Pyongyang, June 22 (KCNA) -- The fourth round of the premier soccer league began at Kim Il Sung Stadium on Tuesday.
					Ten men's and eight women's teams are competing in the tournament. 
					
					 In the first-day matches, the Amnokgang girls defeated their Pyongyang rivals and the Rimyongsu girls their Ponghwasan rivals 2:1 respectively.
					
					 The tournament continues until July 25.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Resignation of Lee Myung Bak Regime Urged
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Resignation of Lee Myung Bak Regime Urged
 Pyongyang, June 22 (KCNA) -- The Lee Myung Bak regime's resignation is what the south Korean people are demanding. It is quite natural that traitor Lee has become an object of public curse and criticism. He has engaged himself in tyranny and arbitrariness, irregularities and unpopular rule since he took office three years ago with false commitments and with the U.S. backing. 
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday says this in a bylined article. 
					
					 Miserable was the fate of south Korea's successive rulers who pursued treacherous, pro-U.S. and fascist policies and sought confrontation with the fellow countrymen in the north, the article notes, adding: 
					
					 The south Korean conservative regime has been plunged into a serious ruling crisis and its treacherous policy is doomed to failure. 
					
					 Such being the situation, the regime persists in the policy of confrontation with the DPRK, calling for "adherence to principle". 
					
					 It is getting hell-bent on the war moves against the DPRK while persistently pursuing confrontation between the north and the south, a policy rejected by all the fellow countrymen, with the backing of foreign forces. What it is seeking is to extremely deteriorate the north-south relations and bring the situation to the brink of nuclear war.
					
					 Distress to the nation should be removed without delay.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Japan Blasted over VTOL Transport Plane
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Japan Blasted over VTOL Transport Plane 
 Pyongyang, June 22 (KCNA) -- Japan is about to allow the deployment of U.S. vertical takeoff and landing (VTOL) transport plane in the Futenma military base, according to Rodong Sinmun Wednesday.
					 The paper said that the U.S., utterly indifferent to the demand of the people in Okinawa, seeks to boost the military and strategic function of the base and use it for realizing its ambition of military supremacy.
					
					 The U.S. says the deployment would help increase the combat capability of the U.S. Marines in Taiwan Strait and on the Korean Peninsula in case of "contingency" and that it is necessary to militarily contain the DPRK and China, the paper said in a commentary, adding: 
					
					 What matters here is Japan's servile attitude to the U.S. 
					
					 Far from demanding the closure of the U.S. military bases in Japan, the Japanese authorities are thinking of explaining the location of a substitute facility for the Futenma airfield and its construction method to the inhabitants after they are confirmed at the "Japan-U.S. Security Consultation".  
					
					 The Japanese people accuse their politicians of bowing to the U.S. pressure. 
					
					 Japan tries to poke its nose in international affairs, talking about "independent diplomacy" even though it blindly dances to the tune of the U.S.

articles.title: S. Korean Police Hit for Suppressing Reunification Activists
articles.content:
S. Korean Police Hit for Suppressing Reunification Activists
 Pyongyang, June 22 (KCNA) -- The People for Achieving Peace and Reunification of south Korea (Phyongthongsa) hit out at the puppet police for its harsh suppression of reunification activists. It issued a statement on June 19.
					 At dawn that day the police searched the houses of the permanent representative of the Taegu-North Kyongsang Provincial Headquarters of the South Side Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration and the policy section chief of the Andong Phyongthongsa and its school, the statement said.
					
					 The police invoked the "National Security Law" for the mere reason that they posed data on the north on homepage, it noted, branding it as apparent crackdown on freedom of thinking and conscience. 
					
					 It noted those data had already been known to the world through media, adding that this is aimed to suppress and downsize the reunification movement.
					
					 The organization will wage a positive struggle against the unwarranted suppression by police, the statement said.

articles.title: Strict Investigation into Environment Pollution Case Urged in S. Korea
articles.content:
Strict Investigation into Environment Pollution Case Urged in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, June 22 (KCNA) -- The People's Measure Council for Probe into Defoliant Case in south Korea called a press conference outside the U.S. military base in Ryongsan, Seoul, on June 16 in demand of a thoroughgoing investigation into the case of environment pollution by the U.S. forces present in south Korea.
					 That day the joint investigation team, consisting of the south Korean authorities and the U.S. forces, announced the deceptive results of investigation into the environment pollution at the U.S. military base in Waegwan.
					
					 Referring to this fact, speakers at the conference said that the results are untrustworthy as they did not meet the demand of the people for survey into soil.
					
					 Location of where defoliant was buried should be made before anything else in order to probe the truth about the case, they urged.
					
					 The U.S. forces' burial of defoliant is posing a grave threat to the health and life of the south Korean people, they said, stressing that the truth about the case should be probed without fail and those responsible for this crime should face a due punishment.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Hit for Evading Blame for Registration Fee Issue
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Hit for Evading Blame for Registration Fee Issue
 Pyongyang, June 22 (KCNA) -- University students of south Korea held a candlelight rally at Chonggye Square in Seoul on June 19 to condemn the puppet authorities for evading the responsibility for the registration fee issue.
					 At the rally speakers said that students are now compelled to stay away from classes or come out for earning money due to the high registration fee.
					
					 But Lee Myung Bak and conservative media are floating a rumor that the failure to honor the commitment to halve registration fee is due to the lack of budget and private schools, they charged.
					
					 It is nonsensical to talk about the lack of budget since the authorities railroaded a bill on the project for improving four large rivers, which needs allocation of tens of trillions of won, and squandered a huge amount of money to arrest the bankruptcy of big businesses, they said.
					
					 The issue of private schools, too, should be settled by the "government", they urged, stating that all assertions of the authorities are nothing but a pretext to evade their responsibility.

articles.title: S. Korea: Authorities Accused of Human Rights Abuses
articles.content:
S. Korea: Authorities Accused of Human Rights Abuses 
 Pyongyang, June 22 (KCNA) -- The Ssangryong Motor Trade Union and various organizations of south Korea held a rally outside the Constitutional Court on June 16 to protest the puppet authorities' human rights abuses.
					 The organizations included the Bar Association for Democratic Society and the Catholic Human Rights Committee.
					
					 The ralliers recalled that the prosecution issued an order to extract gene of members of the said union, who waged an action for vital rights, and forcibly extracted gene from Ryongsan evacuees who have been detained in prison for no ground.
					
					 In order to intensify the suppression of participants in rallies and demos, the authorities cooked up a law on gene-based identification and enforced it from July last year, they noted.
					
					 This evil law has been rejected by various social circles from the outset of its enactment, they said, adding that its unethical nature was confirmed more clearly this time.
					
					 If this law whereby anyone standing against social injustice is to be put under the supervision of the authorities all his life, is allowed to be in force, all the people will be incriminated, they deplored.
					
					 They demanded abolition of this evil law serving to violate human rights.

articles.title: Pakistani Army Dismisses U.S. Reports on Militants' Help
articles.content:
Pakistani Army Dismisses U.S. Reports on Militants' Help
 Pyongyang, June 22 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Pakistani army on June 17 rejected a false report made by New York Times against his country.
					 New York Times recently made a report that elements in Pakistan security forces tipped off terrorists helping them.
					
					 "This assertion is totally false and malicious and the facts on ground are contrary to it," the spokesman said.
					
					 He said that Pakistan is discharging its obligation in combating terrorism.

articles.title: Capitalism Destroys Environment: Iranian President
articles.content:
Capitalism Destroys Environment: Iranian President
 Tehran, June 21 (KCNA) -- Iran's President Mahmoud Ahmadinejad in an interview with Press TV on June 18 branded the hegemonic powers as destroyer of environment.
					 Capitalism is destroying global environment, he said, charging that hegemonic powers with the capitalist idea plunder assets of other nations, kill peoples and destroy the environment.
					
					 Describing the never-ending greed, voracity and selfishness of certain countries as the greatest threats to the environment, he said that the best way to protect the environment is countering the "capitalist" notion.

articles.title: Earthquake Hits Japan
articles.content:
Earthquake Hits Japan
 Pyongyang, June 22 (KCNA) -- A 5.9-magnitude quake jolted Fukushima Prefecture, Japan, on June 18.
					 The epicenter was in waters off the prefecture.

articles.title: S. Korea: War Exercises against DPRK
articles.content:
S. Korea: War Exercises against DPRK
 Pyongyang, June 22 (KCNA) -- The 5th Infantry Division of the puppet army announced on June 20 that it would stage a field tactical drill in the area of Jongok, Ryonchon County, Kyonggi Province, according to Yonhap News of south Korea. 
					 The drill will reportedly last until June 25 with tanks and other offensive weapons and huge troops involved.
					
					 Earlier on June 16, the task battalion and the special MP unit of the 31st Division of the puppet army staged anti-DPRK war exercises in the area of Hongnong Town, Ryonggwang County, South Jolla Province.
					
					 The puppet military warmongers in the grip of war fever are staging war games against the DPRK almost every day.

articles.title: Iran Stands against U.S. Military Presence in Afghanistan
articles.content:
Iran Stands against U.S. Military Presence in Afghanistan 
 Tehran, June 21 (KCNA) -- The Iranian minister of Defence and Armed Forces Logistics in an interview with a TV on June 18 slashed at the U.S. military presence in Afghanistan.
					 The U.S. has claimed that its forces ensure security in Afghanistan, but action is contrary to this assertion, he said, adding that the security of the country has gone from bad to worse since the U.S. military presence there.
					
					 The U.S. keeps its forces in different parts of the world, but such military presence does never contribute to ensuring the security, he said.

articles.title: Repression of Teachers Union Censured in S. Korea
articles.content:
Repression of Teachers Union Censured in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, June 22 (KCNA) -- The Teachers Union of south Korea on June 16 denounced the puppet prosecution for intensified crackdown upon it.
					 The prosecution is expanding the investigation into members of the union, indicted on charges of its relationship with an opposition party, across south Korea with all prosecutors involved, the organization pointed out.
					
					 Lurking behind such suppression is a foolish scheme to weaken the activities of the union, it said, adding that this can never be pardoned.

articles.title: More NATO Soldiers Die in Afghanistan
articles.content:
More NATO Soldiers Die in Afghanistan
 Pyongyang, June 22 (KCNA) -- Two NATO soldiers died in Afghanistan's restive southern region on Saturday. 
					 A total of 249 NATO soldiers, most of them Americans, have been killed in Afghanistan since the beginning of this year.

articles.title: U.S. Plans to Reinforce Its Forces in Japan
articles.content:
U.S. Plans to Reinforce Its Forces in Japan
 Pyongyang, June 22 (KCNA) -- The U.S. is intensifying aggression and military intervention in the DPRK and other Asian countries with Japan as a base.
					 As part of such moves the U.S. Defense Department plans to deploy 12 MV-22 Ospreys, new VTOLs, at the U.S. military base in Fudenma, Okinawa Prefecture, Japan in the fiscal year of 2013.
					
					 Reporting about this, the Japanese Asahi Shimbun on June 18 said that local inhabitants are expressing apprehension over the security of this plane as there were frequent accidents at the stage of its development.

articles.title: China's Paper on Sino-DPRK Projects in Rason
articles.content:
China's Paper on Sino-DPRK Projects in Rason
 Beijing, June 21 (KCNA) -- China's newspaper Huan Qiu Shibao on June 10 carried an article titled "China and DPRK Start Joint Projects in Rason Economic and Trade Zone", which said:
					 Any visitor to Rason can feel everywhere in the city that the DPRK government and people welcome the joint development of the zone by the DPRK and China and attach importance to it.
					
					 In fact, some of the development projects have been carried out to go into operation before the ground-breaking ceremony. 
					
					 A reporter of the paper witnessed the already launched reconstruction project of the road between Quanhe and Rason and banners symbolic of construction units put up along the road. 
					
					 The initial project for updating Rason Port and the road reconstruction project will be finished within this year. Then, the existing earth road will turn into a concrete road and the running distance will be shortened to less than half an hour.

articles.title: U.S. Secret Document on Vietnamese War Opened to Public--Japanese Paper
articles.content:
U.S. Document on Vietnamese War Opened to Public -- Japanese Paper
 Pyongyang, June 22 (KCNA) -- The Japanese paper Sankei Shimbun on June 14 carried the article "Official of the U.S. National Archives Opens to Public Secret Document on Vietnamese War".
					 The official started to open to the public "Pentagon Papers", a confidential document of the U.S. Defense Department which became a motive that forced the U.S. to end the Vietnamese war, the paper said.
					
					 The document is full of lies and tricks used by the U.S. government to intervene in the Vietnamese war.

articles.title: Russian Paper on U.S. Development of Shadow Internet System
articles.content:
Russian Paper on U.S. Development of Shadow Internet System
 Moscow, June 21 (KCNA) -- The U.S. administration plans to increase investment in the development of shadow internet system and independent mobile phone network to help the members of human rights organizations and dissidents communicate among themselves free from government control.
					 The Russian paper Kommersant on June 14 said this in an article entitled "Democracy Spread through Internet".
					
					 The Obama administration approved the development program which can be used for overthrowing governments of other countries, the paper said, quoting the New York Times.
					
					 The article went on:
					
					 Hillary Clinton said the U.S. State Department has no intention to give up the plan of free communication through internet. She also said it offers a historic opportunity to help other countries bring about an affirmative change of the world supported by the U.S.
					
					 The U.S. Defense and State Departments oversee this huge program involving munitions technicians, diplomats, software experts and dissidents selected from 12 countries. 
					
					 The chief of the program said they seek to develop local network infrastructure which is very difficult to control, track and destroy.
					
					 The U.S. State Department allotted 2 million dollars for the development of new technology.
					
					 What is important in the program is a technology of changing the function of blue tooth in mobile phones.
					
					 A massive independent mobile phone network has already undergone test in Afghanistan. The U.S. Defense Department proposed deploying the shadow network in Afghanistan by setting up relay towers inside the U.S. military bases. 
					
					 This system is applicable to other countries. For example, the U.S. is using the mobile communications network in China to gain information about the DPRK. 
					
					 According to the New York Times, this is the very way the VOA reporters financed by the U.S. State Department collect information about the DPRK.

articles.title: Chinese Judicial Officials Give Performance to Mark 90th Anniversary of CPC
articles.content:
Chinese Judicial Officers Give Art Performance to Mark CPC Anniversary
 Beijing, June 21 (KCNA) -- A national art performance of judicial officers was given in Beijing on June 17 to celebrate the 90th anniversary of the Communist Party of China (CPC).
					 The theme of the performance was "Judges for the People". The performance showed the excellent personality and spiritual world of judicial officers willingly adhering to the outlook on the core value of justice and maintaining impartiality and integrity.

articles.title: 12 U.S. Navy Captains Relieved of Post-U.S. Newspaper
articles.content:
12 U.S. Navy Captains Relieved of Post -- U.S. Newspaper
 Pyongyang, June 22 (KCNA) -- 12 captains of the U.S. navy were released from office over the past one year and a half for sexual and drinking scandals, according to the Washington Post.

articles.title: U.S. Newspaper Discloses CIA's Building of Secret Airport in Middle East
articles.content:
U.S. Newspaper Discloses CIA's Building of Secret Airport in Middle East
 Pyongyang, June 22 (KCNA) -- The Central Intelligence Agency (CIA) is building a secret airport in the Middle East, the New York Times said on June 16, quoting a senior official of the U.S. administration.
					 The airfield for drones will be used for expanding secret operations in Yemen and its construction will be completed by the end of this year, the paper said.

articles.title: China Calls for Training Talents
articles.content:
China Calls for Training Talents
 Beijing, June 21 (KCNA) -- Talents are core competitive forces of the state and training of talents is an important duty of the ruling party, Li Yuanchao, member of the Political Bureau and the Secretariat of the C.C., the Communist Party of China and head of its Organization Department, said at a seminar.
					 The People's Daily sponsored the seminar on the party's new ideology on the development of talents in the new century on the occasion of the 90th anniversary of the Communist Party of China.
					
					 Li Yuanchao called for establishing the outlook on the talents in the direction of promoting scientific development and successfully implementing the strategy of building a country of talents.

articles.title: China, Ukraine Agree to Build Strategic Partnership
articles.content:
China, Ukraine Agree to Build Strategic Partnership
 Pyongyang, June 22 (KCNA) -- China and Ukraine agreed to set up and develop strategic partnership between the two countries. This agreement is contained in a joint statement adopted during Chinese President Hu Jintao's visit to Ukraine.
					 During the visit Hu had talks with Ukrainian President Viktor Yanukovich.
					
					 At the talks they exchanged views on issues of developing the bilateral relations and other matters of mutual concern.
					
					 Hu Jintao visited Ukraine from June 18 to 20.

articles.title: Korean People's Spirit Praised by Nepali Paper
articles.content:
Korean People's Spirit Praised by Nepali Paper
 Pyongyang, June 22 (KCNA) -- The Nepali paper Hangk called for learning from the spirit of the Korean people who cherish it as their faith that one is the master of one's own destiny. The paper carried the article titled "What to learn from DPRK" on June 15. It was contributed by a professor of Tribhuvan University of Nepal who visited the DPRK.
					 The members of the delegation of the Study Forum for Self-Reliance of Nepal visited the DPRK on the occasion of the Day of the Sun, the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung, the article said, adding they witnessed the Korean people working with devotion to develop the country, holding their leader in high esteem.
					
					 The article further said:
					
					 The Korean people are convinced they can win the final victory of socialism when they advance along the path indicated by the President.
					
					 The Juche idea authored by him has become the steadfast faith of the Korean people.
					
					 The Songun politics of general secretary　 Kim Jong Il is enjoying absolute support from them. The validity of the Songun politics has been clearly proved in practice.
					
					 The DPRK is handling everything, big or small, with its own strength and wisdom.

articles.title: Peruvians Express Solidarity for Koreans
articles.content:
Peruvians Express Solidarity for Koreans 
 Pyongyang, June 22 (KCNA) -- Peruvian organizations expressed full support for the historic June 15 North-South Joint Declaration and the May 30 statement by a spokesman for the National Defence Commission (NDC) of the DPRK. The NDC statement declared the army and people of the DPRK will no longer deal with the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors of south Korea but launch a nationwide total offensive to put an end to its anti-DPRK confrontation moves.
					 The adoption of the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration brought about signal events in the Korean Peninsula such as the reconnection of railways severed between the two sides and exchanges and cooperation in various fields, said the Peruvian Preparatory Committee for Commemorating the Centenary of Birth of President Kim Il Sung in a statement on June 10.
					
					 The movement for Korea's reunification has faced grave difficulties and inter-Korean relations are deteriorating day by day after the pro-American Lee group took office in south Korea, the statement said.
					
					 Recounting on the NDC statement, the statement said they would join the world progressive people wishing for peace and stability on the Korean Peninsula in denouncing the south Korean authorities' war and confrontation moves. They also vowed to extend selfless support and encouragement to the Korean people in their efforts to reunify the country independently and peacefully, it added.
					
					 The Peruvian Committee for Supporting the Independent and Peaceful Reunification of Korea in a statement on the same day said the joint declaration is the landmark of Korea's reunification. It condemned the U.S. and the south Korean puppet forces for their intensified moves against the DPRK.

articles.title: Anniversary of North-South Joint Declaration Marked by Foreign Media
articles.content:
Anniversary of North-South Joint Declaration Marked by Foreign Media
 Pyongyang, June 22 (KCNA) -- Foreign media marked the 11th anniversary of the historic June 15 North-South Joint Declaration.
					 The Russian paper Patriot No. 22 carried portraits of President Kim Il Sung and general secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 It said:
					
					 The joint declaration is the basic cornerstone of Korea's reunification.
					
					 The idea of "By our nation itself" remains the immutable banner of Korea's reunification though ten odd years have passed since the publication of the joint declaration.
					
					 Korea should be reunified by the efforts of the Koreans with responsibility, according to its will and demand.
					
					 This idea reflects the great national unity, a precondition and basic way of reunification.
					
					 The developments in the Korean Peninsula after the publication of the joint declaration proved Korea can be reunified only when the whole nation is united. 
					
					 Peace and security in the Korean Peninsula will be firmly protected thanks to Kim Jong Il, defender of peace and justice.
					
					 The Peruvian paper Unidad, the Indian paper Passion India and the Cambodian AKP on June 8 and 9 reported details about the course of the adoption of the joint declaration and its significance.
					
					 The Peruvian paper carried a photo of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Foreign Countries Mark Anniversary of Start of Work at WPK
articles.content:
Foreign Countries Mark Anniversary of Start of Work at WPK
 Pyongyang, June 22 (KCNA) -- Meetings took place in South Africa and Switzerland and a seminar in India on June 10 and 11. They were held to mark the 47th anniversary of general secretary Kim Jong Il's start of work at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) and the 11th anniversary of the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration.
					 The chairperson of the Mahlambandlophy, Pretoria City, Branch of the African National Congress of South Africa said the single-minded unity of the leader, the party and the masses has grown stronger and the drive to build a thriving nation has been successfully pushed forward in the DPRK under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The June 15 North-South Joint Declaration was adopted 11 years ago thanks to noble patriotism and broad magnanimity of Kim Jong Il, the chairman of the Switzerland-Korea Committee noted, adding this was a historic event which provided a landmark for Korea's reunification.
					
					 The chairperson of the Indian Working Women Society for Study of the Juche Philosophy praised Kim Jong Il for glorifying the Juche idea as the eternal guiding idea in the era of independence.
					
					 Congratulatory messages to Kim Jong Il were adopted at the events in Switzerland and India.

articles.title: Anniversary of Start of Work at WPK Marked Abroad
articles.content:
Anniversary of Start of Work at WPK Marked Abroad
 Pyongyang, June 22 (KCNA) -- The 47th anniversary of general secretary Kim Jong Il's start of work at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) was marked by organizations of Brazil, Egypt and Colombia. They issued bulletins between June 8 and 10. 
					 Kim Jong Il has applied the principle of giving definite priority to the ideological work in the whole period of leading the revolution and construction. The Brazil-Korea Friendship Association said this in an article with heading "Giving priority to ideological work" and subtitles "Putting main stress on ideology", "By establishing monolithic ideology" and "With might of ideology".
					
					 The Egypt-Korea Friendship Association in its bulletin "DPRK, single-minded unity and Kim Jong Il" praised him for having cemented the single-minded unity of the DPRK in every way since he started work at the WPK Central Committee, adding in the DPRK the leader, the party and the masses are rallied close as one. 
					
					 The Group for the Study of the Juche Idea "Kanggye" of Colombia in its bulletin "Kim Jong Il, June 19, 1964" said he has shown traits as the people's leader from the first day he started his work at the WPK.

articles.title: Party Building Praised by Maltese Officials
articles.content:
Party Building Praised by Maltese Officials
 Pyongyang, June 22 (KCNA) -- Maltese officials issued statements on June 16 on the occasion of the 47th anniversary of general secretary　Kim Jong Il's start of work at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK).
					 The single-minded unity among the leader, the party and the masses is the true picture of the society in the DPRK, said the international secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Malta. The undying feats by Kim Jong Il in the party building are precious assets of the world progressive political parties, he added.
					
					 Chairman John Jamit and Secretary General Jean-Pierre of the Malta-Korea Friendship Association in their joint statement noted: The WPK continues to demonstrate its dignity and might as an invincible party enjoying absolute support by the popular masses as it is led by Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Anniversary of Start of Work at WPK Marked by Foreign Papers
articles.content:
Anniversary of Start of Work at WPK Marked by Foreign Papers
 Pyongyang, June 22 (KCNA) -- Foreign papers carried special write-ups on the occasion of the 47th anniversary of general secretary　Kim Jong Il's start of work at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK).
					 The Lao paper Congtap Pasason Lao on June 13 carried a portrait of Kim Jong Il. The paper said he formulated the Songun politics as the basic political mode under socialism and triumphantly advanced the cause of the WPK and socialism with matchless military power.
					
					 The Cambodian paper Pracheachon on June 14 also carried his photo. The paper praised the undying feats of the peerlessly great man who put the single-minded unity among the leader, the party and the masses on the highest level with his benevolent politics of love and trust and has won victory after victory with its might.
					
					 The Uruguayan paper La Juventud on June 12 carried a photo on his revolutionary activities. The paper said Kim Jong Il made sure the WPK has consistently maintained the idea of President Kim Il Sung as the steadfast guiding idea and invariably held high the banner of the Juche idea even after the demise of the President.
					
					 The International Alliance of Societies for the Study of the Juche Idea and Songun Policy in East European and Central Asian Regions and the Peruvian Communist Party posted articles on Internet website on June 2 and 7 on the same occasion.

articles.title: Feats Praised by British Parties and Organizations, Regional
articles.content:
Feats Praised by British Parties and Organizations, Regional　Organization
 Pyongyang, June 22 (KCNA) -- British political parties and organizations and a regional organization issued statements on the 47th anniversary of general secretary Kim Jong Il's start of work at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) and the 11th anniversary of the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration.
					 They include Communist Party of Great Britain (Marxist-Leninist), the New Communist Party of Britain, the Revolutionary Communist Party of Britain (Marxist-Leninist), the Socialist Labor Party of Britain, the British Branch of the Korean Friendship Association and the European Society for the Study of the Juche Idea. 
					
					 In a joint statement on June 16 they said Kim Jong Il's wise leadership over the WPK in the past clearly proved his distinguished leadership ability.
					
					 The June 15 joint declaration, a landmark of Korea's reunification, opened a new era of independence, peace, reconciliation and unity in the Korean Peninsula, it said. It expressed positive support for the WPK and the Korean people in their efforts to reunify the country independently and peacefully under the uplifted banner of Songun.
					
					 The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy and the British Group for the Study of the Juche Idea in a joint statement on June 15 said it is thanks to the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il that the WPK is throwing its rays as a model of all the world revolutionary parties striving for independence and socialism.

articles.title: Work Off Press in Austria
articles.content:
Work Off Press in Austria
 Pyongyang, June 22 (KCNA) -- General secretary Kim Jong Il's work "Our Socialism Centred on the Masses Shall Not Perish" was brought out in booklet by the Joseph Gebauer Publishing House in Vienna, Austria on June 15.
					 The work was published on May 5, Juche 80 (1991). It clarifies the inevitability of the victory of socialism, the secret of solidity and invincibility of socialism in the DPRK and its essential characteristics.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun critica proceder proyanqui de Japon
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun critica proceder proyanqui de Japon
 Pyongyang, 22 de junio (ATCC) -- Las autoridades japonesas pretenden tolerar el emplazamiento de los aviones de transporte de despegue y aterrizaje verticales de Estados Unidos en la base militar norteamericana de Futenma, volviendo a revelar su asqueroso aspecto ante la sociedad internacional. 
					 Senala el diario Rodong Sinmun en un comentario individual de este miercoles y prosigue:
					
					 EE.UU. persigue la malsana intencion de convertir Okinawa en la base militar con la capacidad estrategica mas reforzada que en el tiempo anterior y utilizarla a la realizacion de su ambicion hegemonica, dando espaldas a la opinion publica de los habitantes locales. 
					
					 EE.UU. dice abiertamente que en el caso de emplazar los aviones de transporte de nuevo tipo en Okinawa, podria "fortalecer" la combatividad del cuerpo de marines norteamericanos en el "tiempo de emergencia" del Estrecho de Taiwan y de la Peninsula Coreana.
					
					 Lo mas cuestionable es que las autoridades japonesas se adhieren a esta medida militar de EE.UU.
					
					 En lugar de demandar la abolicion de las bases militares norteamericanas en Japon, las autoridades de este pais isleno tratan de explicar a los habitantes locales la posicion y los metodos de instalacion de los equipos sustituibles del aeropuerto militar de Futenma.
					
					 Los habitantes japoneses repudian el proceder humillante de los politiqueros japoneses que suelen hablar de la "diplomacia independiente" obedeciendo a ciegas a su amo norteamericano.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun demanda retirada de  banda de Lee Myung Bak
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun demanda retirada de  banda de Lee Myung Bak
 Pyongyang, 22 de junio (ATCC) -- El diario Rodong Sinmun, en un articulo individual editado este miercoles, senala que la retirada de la banda de conservadores de Lee Myung Bak es la demanda de la opinion publica del Sur de Corea.
					 Es natural que esta repudiado por los surcoreanos el traidor Lee, quien recurre a las atrocidades, arbitrariedades, fraudes y la politica antipopular desde cuando tomo hace 3 anos el poder con la fraudulencia y el engano bajo el amparo de Estados Unidos,  comienza el articulista y continua:
					
					 Historicamente, fueron tristes los destinos de los ex gobernantes surcoreanos que tomaron el camino de traicion a la patria manteniendo la vida con el servilismo a EE.UU., la confrontacion fratricida y la represion fascista.
					
					 Ahora, la camarilla del traidor Lee padece de crisis irrecuperables en su toma de poder y la politica traidora esta a punto de derrumbarse.
					
					 A pesar de esto, intenta seguir su politica conflictiva anti-RPDC so pretexto del "mantenimiento de principios".
					
					 Empeora las relaciones intercoreanas para asi llevar la situacion de la Peninsula Coreana al borde de la guerra nuclear.
					
					 Hay que eliminar sin demora el dolor de cabeza de la nacion.

articles.title: Nueva telenovela Nuestro equipo de futbol femenino
articles.content:
Nueva telenovela Nuestro equipo de futbol femenino
 Pyongyang, 22 de junio (ATCC) -- En Corea se proyecta la telenovela recien producida Nuestro equipo de futbol femenino.
					 Este drama de 5 partes se trata de las actividades del equipo coreano que sobresalio en el 3o Campeonato Mundial de Jovenes de Futbol (f).
					
					 Describe emocionantemente el sentimiento ideologico del protagonista quien se hizo entrenador responsable, sucediendo a su maestro, y dedica todo lo suyo con el alma de glorificar a todo el mundo el honor de la patria. 
					
					 Ademas, muestra en cuadros vividos el noble mundo espiritual e ingentes esfuerzos de las jugadoras quienes superan las fatigas fisicas sudando mucho en los ejercicios con la meta de ganar la medalla de oro en el campeonato internacional.
					
					 Aparecen en la pantalla Jon Myong Hui y otras futbolistas renombradas.

articles.title: Cultura Taedonggang
articles.content:
Cultura Taedonggang
 Pyongyang, 22 de junio (ATCC) -- La cultura Taedonggang, una de las 5 civilizaciones del mundo, es la antigua que habia surgido en la cuenca del rio Taedong en torno a Pyongyang.
					 Corea Antigua habia aparecido a principios del siglo 30 a.n.e. como uno de los primeros Estados del mundo y creado la civilizacion antigua teniendo como centro la zona de Pyongyang.
					
					 Si se toman en cuenta las ruinas y reliquias historicas descubiertas, pueden conocer que la cuenca del rio Taedong fue una de las cunas de civilizacion mundial donde se desarrollaron la agricultura y la cultura de varios sectores como articulos de bronce, ceramicas, astronomia, letras, etc.
					
					 Entre los vestigios valiosos de la zona estan los dolmenes, tumbas tapadas con piedras grandes, ruinas de grandes poblados, murallas antiguas, solares de casa, etc.
					
					 En el 87 (1998) de la Era Juche, la Asociacion de Historiadores de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea denomino la cultura de la Corea de Tangun como la "Cultura Taedonggang" y la proclamo como una de las 5 civilizaciones del mundo.
